verses.kjv: And Israel abode in Shittim, and the people began to commit whoredom with the daughters of Moab.
verses.ct: While Israel was staying in Shittim, the men began having sexual relations with Moabite women.

verses.kjv: And they called the people unto the sacrifices of their gods: and the people did eat, and bowed down to their gods.
verses.ct: These women invited the Israelites to the sacrificial feasts of their gods, and the people ate the sacrificial food and worshiped those gods.

verses.kjv: And Israel joined himself unto Baalpeor: and the anger of the LORD was kindled against Israel.
verses.ct: So Israel devoted themselves to Baalpeor, and the LORD's anger burned against Israel.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Moses, Take all the heads of the people, and hang them up before the LORD against the sun, that the fierce anger of the LORD may be turned away from Israel.
verses.ct: The LORD told Moses, "Gather all the leaders of the people and execute them in broad daylight in the LORD's presence, so that the LORD's fierce anger will turn away from Israel."

verses.kjv: And Moses said unto the judges of Israel, Slay ye every one his men that were joined unto Baalpeor.
verses.ct: Moses instructed the judges of Israel, "Each of you must kill the men under your authority who devoted themselves to Baalpeor."

verses.kjv: And, behold, one of the children of Israel came and brought unto his brethren a Midianitish woman in the sight of Moses, and in the sight of all the congregation of the children of Israel, who were weeping before the door of the tabernacle of the congregation.
verses.ct: Right then, an Israelite man brought a Midianite woman to his brothers, right in front of Moses and the entire community of Israel, while they were all weeping at the entrance of the tent of meeting.

verses.kjv: And when Phinehas, the son of Eleazar, the son of Aaron the priest, saw it, he rose up from among the congregation, and took a javelin in his hand;
verses.ct: When Phinehas son of Eleazar, the grandson of Aaron the priest, saw this, he got up from the middle of the assembly and grabbed a spear.

verses.kjv: And he went after the man of Israel into the tent, and thrust both of them through, the man of Israel, and the woman through her belly. So the plague was stayed from the children of Israel.
verses.ct: He followed the Israelite man into the tent and drove the spear through both of them — through the Israelite man and through the woman's stomach. After that, the plague among the Israelites was stopped.

verses.kjv: And those that died in the plague were twenty and four thousand.
verses.ct: But 24,000 people had already died from the plague.

verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.ct: Then the LORD spoke to Moses and said,

verses.kjv: Phinehas, the son of Eleazar, the son of Aaron the priest, hath turned my wrath away from the children of Israel, while he was zealous for my sake among them, that I consumed not the children of Israel in my jealousy.
verses.ct: "Phinehas son of Eleazar, the grandson of Aaron the priest, has turned my anger away from the Israelites. Because he was as passionate for my honor as I am, I did not destroy the Israelites in my jealousy.

verses.kjv: Wherefore say, Behold, I give unto him my covenant of peace:
verses.ct: Therefore, announce this: I am giving him my covenant of peace.

verses.kjv: And he shall have it, and his seed after him, even the covenant of an everlasting priesthood; because he was zealous for his God, and made an atonement for the children of Israel.
verses.ct: He and his descendants after him will hold a covenant of permanent priesthood, because he was passionate for his God and made atonement for the Israelites."

verses.kjv: Now the name of the Israelite that was slain, even that was slain with the Midianitish woman, was Zimri, the son of Salu, a prince of a chief house among the Simeonites.
verses.ct: The Israelite man who was killed along with the Midianite woman was named Zimri son of Salu, a leader of a prominent family among the tribe of Simeon.

verses.kjv: And the name of the Midianitish woman that was slain was Cozbi, the daughter of Zur; he was head over a people, and of a chief house in Midian.
verses.ct: The Midianite woman who was killed was named Cozbi daughter of Zur, who was the head of a clan and a prominent family in Midian.

verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD spoke to Moses and said,

verses.kjv: Vex the Midianites, and smite them:
verses.ct: "Treat the Midianites as enemies and attack them,

verses.kjv: For they vex you with their wiles, wherewith they have beguiled you in the matter of Peor, and in the matter of Cozbi, the daughter of a prince of Midian, their sister, which was slain in the day of the plague for Peor’s sake.
verses.ct: because they treated you as enemies through their deception. They tricked you in the incident at Peor and through Cozbi, the daughter of a Midianite leader — their kinswoman who was killed on the day of the plague that came because of Peor."
